reviewText: We all have seen I Love Lucy - The Complete First Season (1951-57) and its continuation with new 13 one-hour episodes I Love Lucy - The Complete Seasons 7-9. Shortly after the very last episode "Lucy Meets the Mustache", with Ernie Kovacs and Edie Adams, was filmed, Lucille Ball filed for divorce from Desi Arnaz. Lucy came back to CBS with a new tv series, The Lucy Show (1962-68). Vivian Vance also returned to help her friend Lucy with the new show. She stayed for 3 seasons. William Frawley made a guest appearance in Season 4. Desi Arnaz and Lucille Ball never appeared on a tv series together again, but Desi was on the set as "executive producer". During the course of the show you will notice some changes made. This is called a "re-tool". The children disappeared and the house changed, now in color. Guess I will have to buy all of the Lucy Show tv series to find out what happened.  The Lucy Show: The Official First Season.  The Lucy Show: The Official Second Season.  Lucy Show: Official Third Season.  Lucy Show: Official Fourth Season. As of 2011, Season 5, 6, and 7 are not available yet, however you can see some of those color episodes in this DVD Collection set from Madacy Home Video. This is Volume 2 with 10 episodes total from 2-discs. Season One, episode 18, broadcast January 28, 1963, black & white. Season One, episode 19, broadcast February 4, 1963, black & white. Season Five, episode 7, broadcast October 31, 1966, color. Season Five, episode 8, broadcast November 7, 1966, color. Season Five, episode 14,broadcast January 2, 1967, color. Season Five, episode 17, broadcast January 23, 1967, color. Season Five, episode 22, broadcast March 6, 1967, color. Season Six, episode 3, broadcast September 25, 1967, color. Season Six, episode 4, broadcast October 2, 1967, color. Season Six, episode 8, broadcast October 30, 1967, color. Regulars: Vivian Vance, Candy Moore, Ralph Hart, Billy Garrett, Gale Gordon. Guest stars: Frankie Avalon, Mary Jane Croft, Lew Parker, Lucie Arnaz, Robert Goulet, Mary Wickes, Carol Burnett, Dan Rowan, Dick Martin, Carole Cook, Hans Conried, Ruta Lee, Jacques Bergerac, Mel Torme, Hal Smith, Burt Mustin, Paul Winchell, Sheldon Leonard. Bonus Features: Disc One: Biography-about the Lucy Show, Trivia Quiz, upcoming feature with David Nelson in "Ozzie & Harriet". Classic commercials: Post Toasties with Andy Griffith, 3 American Cancer Society with John Wayne, Hamm's Beer, The National Foundation March of Dimes with Mark Hamill. Disc Two: Biography-about the Lucy Show, Trivia Quiz, upcoming feature with Rick Nelson in ballet tights in "Ozzie & Harriet". Classic commercials: Wheaties cereal, Coca-Cola, Flintstones vitamins. The tv prints are not restored, but have that old syndicated look. However, I enjoyed all 10 episodes in this set. I received this Lucy Show DVD set from my daughter and didn't have the heart to tell her I had already bought "The Lucy Show: The Official First Season" for myself. However, this volume contains episodes I have not seen yet. I was in the womb or had already been born during these episodes in this set. So I do appreciate my daughter's gift and will keep it in my collections at home. The Lucy Show began October 1, 1962, so I wonder if I was conceived during the Lucy Show. Funny line from Gale Gordon, "...more fun than banking?" You will see Carol Burnett in her first and second appearance working with Lucille Ball. She adored Lucy so much. The next year, Carol would begin her own variety show on CBS, The Carol Burnett Show. Incidentally, Lucy had passed away on Carol's birthday on April 26, 1989 at the age of 77. Dick Martin would leave The Lucy Show to team up with Dan Rowan on NBC for Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In (1968-73). After The Lucy Show ended in 1968, Lucy restyled the show again and named it, "Here's Lucy". She brought back Gale Gordon as her boss again. Vivian Vance would visit once in a while. Lucy added her real-life children to the cast Lucie Arnaz and Desi Arnaz Jr.  Here's Lucy: Season One. Here's Lucy: Season Two. Here's Lucy: Season Three (4pc). Here's Lucy: Season Four.
